slow.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: not moving, being done, or happening quickly
slow.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The car was travelling at a very slow speed.
The economy faces a year of slower growth.
Take a few deep, slow breaths.
slow.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Taylor was concerned at the slow progress of the investigations.
The legal system can be painfully slow (=much too slow).
The wound was slow to heal.
slow.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: if you are slow to do something, you do not do it as soon as you can or should
slow.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Farmers have been slow to exploit this market.
Their attitude was slow to change.
He has been slow in announcing the name of his successor.
New ideas have been slow in coming.
slow.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: taking a longer time than something similar
slow.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: We got on the slow train  (=one that stops at more stations) by mistake.
slow.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: if business or trade is slow, there are not many customers or not much is sold
slow.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: Business is often slow in the afternoon.
The company is experiencing slow sales.
slow.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: if a clock or watch is slow, it is showing a time earlier than the correct time
slow.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: The clock is about five minutes slow.
slow.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: not good or quick at understanding things
slow.translation[0].definitions[6].examp: Teaching assistants have time to help the slower pupils.
slow.translation[0].definitions[7].defin: a slow film does not react to light very easily
slow.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: slow
not moving quickly or not doing something quickly
I was always one of the slowest runners in my class.
My computer’s really slow compared to the ones at school.
gradual
happening, developing, or changing slowly over a long period of time
a gradual rise in the Earth’s temperature
I’ve noticed a gradual improvement in his work.
leisurely
moving or doing something slowly, especially because you are enjoying what you are doing and do not have to hurry
a leisurely breakfast
They walked at a leisurely pace.
unhurried
moving or doing something in a slow and calm way, without rushing at all
She continued to listen, seeming relaxed and unhurried.
the doctor’s calm unhurried manner
sluggish
moving or reacting more slowly than usual, especially because of a loss of power or energy. Also used when business, sales, or the economy seem very slow
The car seems rather sluggish going uphill.
The drink was making her sluggish.
the company’s sluggish performance this year
Sales have been sluggish.
lethargic
moving slowly, because you feel as if you have no energy and no interest in doing anything
She woke up feeling heavy and lethargic.
His son seemed depressed and lethargic.
languid
slow and with very little energy or activity – used about people, actions, or periods of time
She lifted her hand in a languid wave.
a long languid afternoon in the middle of summer
He was pale and had rather a languid air about him.
glacial
extremely slow – used especially about the speed at which something happens
Things are changing, but at a glacial pace.
slow.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to become slower or to make something slower
slow.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Her breathing slowed and she fell asleep.
Ian slowed up as he approached the traffic lights.
slow.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: If you go slower, you’ll see much more.
slow.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: Consumer borrowing has slowed noticeably since Jan. 1.
They’re delaying sales reports to the factory to slow down shipments of new cars.
slow.translation[4].definitions[0].defin: not happening, being done, or moving with much speed or not as quickly as it should
slow.translation[4].definitions[0].examp: Prices are rising, but at a slower pace than before.
a period of slow economic growth
We expect a slow improvement in sales.
Designing a new car can be a slow process.
slow.translation[4].definitions[1].examp: The city has been slow to follow through on many of the budget cuts it promised.
slow.translation[4].definitions[2].defin: if business or trade is slow, there are not many customers or not many things are sold
slow.translation[4].definitions[2].examp: Manufacturers say that business remains slow.
Monday is usually the slowest day of the week.
